channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Signs damaged, 3rd February
item.description:
Battle Road junction of lower road every night at 3am heavy Artic lorries keep crashing into the yellow signs - and these are being replaced every week by the council This road is not suitable for HGV's and there is a sign stating this but they still use it, this was also reported last year but nothing has changed. The signs need to be replaced again. This needs immediate attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battle Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Large pothole, 3rd February
item.description:
A few moths ago there was roadworks in this road and the road was dug up, but just recently a pothole has developed in the middle of the road where the work had taken place and it getting bigger daily and residents are concerned about this, could this be inspected urgently please.

item.title: Dent in road - collapsing drain ?, 3rd February
item.description:
There is a marked dip in the road to the south side of the manhole cover, suggesting it is collapsing into a void. The depression itself doesn't show well in the photos but not that vehicles have scraped the road/ Fixing it before it collapses might be a good idea

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valeswood Road, Downham, Greater London

item.title: Blocked drain, 3rd February
item.description:
The drain outside 7 Elm road is blocked and has been for over 2 years the water then gathers in the pot hole that was temporarily repaired a week or so ago which is now in need of yet another repair which soaks pedestrians when the buses pull in , completely drenching a little old lady
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, High Street, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree only half felled, 3rd February
item.description:
Last week a crew suspended parking in Sidewood Rd and early in the AM proceeded to cut/prune just one tree!! The noise was horrendous and this is the result!! No tidying up around the stump, it looks awful. Why??

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidewood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Countdown unit needs to be replaced, 3rd February
